results.title: The Fountains of Bernini
results.creator_credit: Paul Buckhurst, Robert Hillmann and Centre for Mass Communication, Columbia University
results.brief_description: Takes a look at some of the most important fountains in the history of western art and the life of the genius who created them. The atmosphere of the Baroque Age and Bernini’s own religious, political and aesthetic ideas are conveyed visually as well as through music and narration. Narrated by Steven Gilburn.

results.title: Kangaroos. Part 1. Biography [Greek version]
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Wildlife”.
Part one begins with the evolution of the kangaroo, tracing its development into over 50 species, from tree-dwellers to the better-known “big red”. The feeding, and mating habits of various species are examined, also birth and development in the pouch are studied. Narrated by Lionel Long. In Greek language.

results.title: The Forsyte saga (2002) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Christopher Menaul, Sita Williams and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: Originally produced in 1967 by the BBC, John Galsworthy’s popular novel of life in early 20th century London as seen through the eyes of the Forsyte family is given a fresh injection of talent and production values in this 2002 Granada Television mini-series. Set in Victorian England, sex, corruption, greed and jealousy characterise the machinations and minutiae of two branches of the same family, headed by the patriarchs Jolyon (Corin Redgrave) and James (John Carlisle) Forsyte. Cast includes: Damian Lewis, Rupert Graves, Gina McKee, Corin Redgrave, Ioan Gruffudd. Written by Stephen Mallatratt.

results.title: The Forests and Vladimir Krajina
results.creator_credit: Peter Katadotis, Tom Radford, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Visually seductive, this film uncovers a few hard truths under the packaging. Dr. Vladimir Krajina, botanist and teacher, is waging a successful battle in British Columbia for the creation of ecological reserves. He explains the importance of such sanctuaries and why people must know and respect nature’s laws if the future needs of the industry and the desire for a high quality of life are to be reconciled. Written by Barry Cowling and narrated by Stanley Jackson.

results.title: The Forgotten toys
results.creator_credit: Graham Ralph, Karen Davidsen and Herbert Raplh Entertainment Company
results.brief_description: Joanna Lumley and Bob Hoskins are the voices of Annie, a refined rag doll and Teddy, a gruff old bear, in this adapatation of James Stevenson’s book “The Night after Christmas.” The two are discarded by their owners when they receive new toys and are determined to escape from the dustbin to find new children who will love them. A delightful animated tale of friendship and hope.

results.title: The Forest: pulp logger
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The history of the timber industry in Eastern Canada. England deprived of its timber supplies after Napoleon’s conquest of Europe turned to Canada. The move west in America increased the demand for timber, and the advent of newspapers created a need for wood pulp. Today the highly mechanised timber industry makes Canada the largest exporter in the world.

results.title: The Forest watchers
results.creator_credit: Peter Raymont, Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The Forest watchers tells us some remarkable things about one of our great natural resources. For example, nearly one half of Canada is forest, by the end of the century the supply might fall short of the demand. This film looks at the Canadian forests and the elements threatening them. These include the spruce budworm, air pollution and indiscriminate logging operations. Man is in the process of developing a new vision of the forest through the advent of remote sensing techniques. Written by Peter Raymont; photographed by Andreas Poulsson, Raymond Dumas; music by Larry Crosley.

results.title: The Forest regions of Canada
results.creator_credit: Herb Taylor, Frank Spiller and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A country-wide survey of the changing technology of lumbering and the system of long-range reforestation. Shown is a machine that strips a tree of branches, then neatly bites through the base and lowers it onto a timber carrier; and a machine that reduces logs to wood chips right in the forest, for easier transport to the mill. Animated maps show the locations of the various forest regions of Canada. (Award: Santarem).

results.title: The Followers
results.creator_credit: Gilles Blais, Georges Dufaux, Jacques Bobet and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Filmed mainly at the Montreal community of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness, this film revolves around three young Quebecers, Michel, Robert and Johane, from their first days in the temple to their initiation six months later. The film examines the family life of Krishna members, the active proselytising in the streets, the temple rituals, and the role of women and their reliance on men for spiritual guidance. This film affords a close look at one of the controversial new religious organisations to have emerged from the Sixties in the United States. An English version of a French film.

results.title: The Forest of trees and logs
results.creator_credit: Jerome Kurtz, Michael Halperin, H/K Films and K Films
results.brief_description: The forest is explored as a place of life - an environment with inter-relationships harbouring the living, providing food, and which, even in decay brings forth vitality. Our understanding of the role forests play in the biosphere of the planet may help us aid the forests to return to the grandeur which once was theirs.
